meanings.definition: The condition of a plant organ, typically a leaf, developing into a petal.
meanings.sent1: The petalody of the leaf made it look like a flower.
meanings.sent2: The botanist observed the petalody of the plant's leaves with interest.
meanings.sent3: The petalody of the leaf confused the bees, who thought it was a flower.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like the petalody of a leaf turning into a petal.
meanings.sent5: The petalody of the leaf was a beautiful transformation to witness.

meanings.definition: The process of a plant organ, such as a stamen, transforming into a petal.
meanings.sent1: The petalody of the stamen surprised the gardener.
meanings.sent2: Botanists study the petalody of plant organs to understand their development.
meanings.sent3: The petalody of the stamen was like a magical disguise.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed like the petalody of a stamen becoming a petal.
meanings.sent5: The petalody of the stamen added a touch of whimsy to the garden.
